channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: DNC Day 4: Complete schedule and IST timings
item.description: The final day of the 2024 Democratic National Convention in Chicago highlights Vice President Kamala Harris accepting her party's nomination. Themed “For Our Future,” the event includes various important speeches, celebrity appearances, and performances. The Democratic Party aims to present a cohesive front, energizing supporters, and preparing for the upcoming 2024 elections.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Gus Walz’s emotional support for his dad Tim at DNC captured hearts. But then the bullies came
item.description: During the Democratic National Convention, Minnesota Governor Tim Walz and his son Gus shared an emotional moment, later marred by online bullying. Gus, who has a nonverbal learning disorder, faced cruel comments primarily from Trump supporters, raising concerns among disability advocates.

item.title: Husband of missing Northern Virginia woman charged with concealing a dead body
item.description: Naresh Bhatt, 28, has been arrested in Manassas Park, Virginia, on charges of concealing a dead body amid the ongoing search for his missing wife, Mamta Kafle Bhatt. The investigation, involving multiple local agencies, continues as the couple's one-year-old daughter is now in social services’ care. Naresh awaits arraignment and is held without bond.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'F**k American Airlines': Rapper fumes after he's asked to change seat. 'I am celebrity. I'm going to...'
item.description: Rapper Juvenile had an altercation with the American Airlines staff following which he got off the plane as he was asked to give up his first-class seat. The rapper claimed that he was asked to move to the economy class on the Dallas-bound flight. Juvenile refused to do so and instead got off the flight. "I'm a celebrity. I'm telling you this is going to be repercussions," he said as he filmed the altercation.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: AI images of Jesus Christ from Shroud of Turin go viral, sparking old debate
item.description: Recent X-ray analysis suggests that the Shroud of Turin could be 2,000 years old, renewing interest in its authenticity. AI-generated images of Jesus, inspired by the shroud, have surfaced online, resembling classical depictions. ​​The Shroud of Turin, long held by Christians as the burial cloth of Jesus, has faced skepticism due to a 1980s dating analysis that suggested it was a medieval forgery from the 1300s. The study supporting this used fabrics dating to 55-74 CE and noted Middle Eastern pollen, challenging former claims of it being a medieval forgery.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Beyonce or Taylor Swift? Social media chatter over unexpected guest at DNC final day
item.description: Will either of Beyonce or Taylor Swift make an appearance at the Democratic National Convention on the last day as Kamala Harris accepts the party's nomination as the presidential candidate? Social media was buzzing with suspense with people looking for Beyonce and Taylor's jet details on Thursday as after Oprah Winfrey's surprise appearance on Wednesday, Democrat fans have been expecting nothing short of a Beyonce or a Taylor Swift appearance.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 9-month-old dies after being left in hot car for nearly 8 hours in Texas
item.description: A 9-month-old child tragically died after being left in a car for nearly eight hours by the grandmother in Beeville, Texas. Authorities are investigating it as a possible criminal homicide, citing heat-related causes. The incident highlights a growing issue, with 25 similar deaths in 2024 and Texas leading in such fatalities.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Ahead of Kamala Harris' acceptance speech comes Doug's anniversary message: 'Forever to go'
item.description: ​Vice President Kamala Harris is all set to formally accept the Democratic presidential nomination at the party convention tonight. But the day also marks another special occasion in her life -- on August 22, 2014, Kamala Harris and Doug Emhoff got married. Ten years of marriage, forever to go. Happy anniversary, @VP. I love you,” Emhoff wrote Thursday on social platform X, along with a video celebrating their love story.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US FDA approves updated Covid shots ahead of fall and winter
item.description: The FDA has approved updated Covid-19 vaccines from Pfizer and Moderna targeting the KP.2 variant for an autumn vaccination drive. These vaccines are expected to provide better protection against severe symptoms of circulating variants. The shots for children below 12 years are cleared under the agency's emergency use authorization pathway. Novavax's protein-based vaccine is still under review.

item.title: Arkansas supreme court blocks abortion question from state ballot over paperwork error
item.description: The Arkansas Supreme Court has blocked an attempt to put abortion rights on the November ballot due to procedural paperwork issues. This setback leaves Arkansas' strict abortion laws unchanged, allowing termination only in medical emergencies, rape, or incest. Despite meeting the signature requirement, the ruling relies on the legal technicality regarding paid canvassers.

item.title: Jermaine Jenas fired by BBC over workplace conduct complaints
item.description: Jermaine Jenas, a former footballer and presenter on BBC’s The One Show and Match of the Day, has been dismissed from the BBC due to workplace conduct complaints. Allegations involving digital communications were key in the decision. Jenas retired from football in 2016 and successfully transitioned to media. He was last on air earlier this summer and also co-founded the Aquinas Foundation. He earned between £190,000 and £194,999 for his roles at the BBC.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Donald Trump speaks for 5 minutes on Project 2025: 'I have no idea'
item.description: Donald Trump talked for a straight five minutes without taking a breath on Fox and Friends when he was asked to comment on Democrat VP candidate Tim Walz's statement accusing Donald Trump's connection with the controversial Project 2025. But the main takeaway from what he said was that he had no idea about Project 2025 which he said earlier as well.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Buckingham Palace guard on duty slips and falls in viral video
item.description: A Buckingham Palace King's guard slipped and fell while on duty but quickly got back on his feet. Filmed by Anthony Smith, the guard's swift recovery amused many. The stoic guards endure rigorous training and earn a starting salary of around $33,000, with benefits like subsidized meals and healthcare.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Robert F Kennedy Jr's withdrawal will benefit Kamala Harris, predicts 'Nostradamus' of US presidential polls
item.description: Allan Lichtman, known for his accurate US presidential election predictions, suggests that Robert F Kennedy Jr's withdrawal may benefit Kamala Harris. Despite Kennedy's endorsement of Donald Trump, Lichtman states it won't affect the outcome. He will make his official prediction after the Democratic convention.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Ann Coulter called 'bully', 'soulless' after her 'weird' attack on Gus Walz
item.description: Conservative author Ann Coulter was schooled on X after she called Tim Walz's son Gus Walz 'weird' at a time when Gus was winning hearts showing the world how to be take pride in parents' achievements. As Tim Walz accepted the nomination as the vice president candidate of the Democratic party, 17-year-old Guz Walz -- in the audience -- could not contain his pride and happiness.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: California hospital sued for failing to notify family of daughter's death for nearly a year
item.description: The family of Jessie Peterson is seeking $25 million in damages from a California hospital, claiming the facility failed to inform them of her death for nearly a year. Peterson, a Type 1 diabetic, died shortly after asking her mother to pick her up from the hospital where she was admitted.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Donald Trump says he'd be honored if Kennedy Jr endorses him: 'Women love...'
item.description: ​​Former president and Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump Thursday reacted to the speculations of independent candidate RKF Jr dropping out of the race and endorsing him. Appearing on the Fox News, Trump said Kennedy Jr is a different kind of a guy. ​"But, overall, I thought the Democrats, he was a Democrat, I don’t know what he is right now. But he was a Democrat. They treated him very badly. I think he would have, he goes around saying he would have beaten Biden in the primary. I think there was a good chance," Trump said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who is Tahil Sharma, interfaith activist who concluded DNC's third day with Hindu and Sikh prayers?
item.description: Interfaith activist Tahil Sharma wrapped up the third day of the Democratic National Convention in Chicago with Hindu and Sikh prayers, joined by Rev. William Emmanuel Hall. They emphasized peace for Palestine and Israel after Minnesota governor Tim Walz accepted the vice-presidential nomination. Sharma supports interfaith communities and advocates for justice and equity.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Tragedy of Shakespearan proportions': Tragic story of Mike Lynch and his Bayesian superyacht that capsized near Sicily
item.description: Brent Hoberman, founder of lastminute.com and a friend of Lynch, told the BBC, "It's deeply tragic, and the timing feels like something out of a Shakespearean tragedy. He had just spent 12 years fighting to clear his name and was on a celebratory cruise with those who stood by him during that incredibly difficult period."
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Unacceptable: Muslim Women for Harris withdraws support after Palestinian speaker refused slot
item.description: ​They wanted a slot for a Palestinian-American speaker at the Democratic National Convention. Wednesday evening, they got a call from the organizers and the reply was 'no' following which Muslim Women for Harris announced that they are disbanding and can't continue to support Kamala Harris and Tim Walz. “This is a terrible message to send to Democrats. Palestinians have the right to speak about Palestine. We pray that the DNC and VP Harris team makes the right decision before this convention is over. For the sake of each of us,” the statement from Muslim Women for Harris said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
